result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler John Pecha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misdemeanor Bail Jumping, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Misdemeanor Bail Jumping, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event that the defendant is discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent SHALL notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment SHALL be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Defendant is to pay court costs within the 1st year of probation.
Defendant is to obtain full-time employment.
Defendant is to comply with any treatment/programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and agent.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to Count 1.
